description:
## ✅ **1. Definition of R² (Coefficient of Determination)**

R² measures **how well a linear regression model explains the variation in the dependent variable y**:

```math
R^2 = \frac{SSR}{SST} = 1 - \frac{SSE}{SST}
```

Where:

* **SST (Total Sum of Squares)**: total variation of y relative to its mean
* **SSR (Regression Sum of Squares)**: part of y’s variation explained by the model
* **SSE (Residual Sum of Squares)**: part of y’s variation not explained by the model

---

# ✅ **2. Interpretation of R²**

| R² Value | Meaning                                              |
| -------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| 0        | Model cannot explain any variation in y (poor fit)   |
| 0.1–0.3  | Model explains only a small portion of y’s variation |
| 0.3–0.5  | Model has moderate explanatory power                 |
| 0.5–0.7  | Model fits reasonably well                           |
| 0.7–0.9  | Model fits very well                                 |
| 0.9–1    | Model almost perfectly explains y’s variation        |

* **Higher R²** → the regression model explains more of y’s variation
* **Lower R²** → the model fits poorly
